page.title: 06FARMING NEAR HALLOW
page.content: There are many{farms}in this area.Most of the farms grow{crops}such as grass, beans, barley,fodderbeat and oats in fields of approx.12 acres.The crops are sold except for those used for animal food such as grass to feed the cattle and sheep in Winter. There are many{animals}kept, bulls, cows, pigs, lambs, sheep and horses. Some of these work on the farm others are sold usually in late Winter or early Spring. Most of the cows are Friesians kept for their milk. The farms have some very expensive{equipment}e.g a tractor costing Â£10,000.Other machines include a combine harvester,sprayer and land rover.One farm was over 350 years old and the family had lived there for 110 years. Because of their age the{farmhouses}have to be regulaly repaired and decorated.Most farms keep dogs and cats as pets.
